title: Prohibition: risk assessment to predict criminal offence based solely on profiling or personality traits

article_refs.quote: the placing on the market, the putting into service for this specific purpose, or the use of an AI system for making risk assessments of natural persons in order to assess or predict the risk of a natural person committing a criminal offence, when based solely on profiling or on assessing personality traits and characteristics; ... this prohibition shall not apply to AI systems used to support the human assessment ... based on objective and verifiable facts directly linked to a criminal activity;

legal_consequence.verbatim: Prohibited: AI systems for risk assessment to assess/predict risk of committing a criminal offence when based solely on profiling or on assessing personality traits/characteristics. Exception for support to human assessment based on objective/verifiable facts directly linked to a criminal activity.

items.label: Recital (3) — specific restrictions for LE risk assessments
items.text: This Regulation contains specific rules restricting the use of AI systems for risk assessments of natural persons for the purpose of law enforcement.

items.label: Recital (10) — profiling and data protection
items.text: Existing Union data protection law governs profiling and automated decision-making; data subjects retain rights under GDPR/LED/EUDPR. This Regulation complements, not replaces, those regimes.
